title: Poly pulls out of the running for Yuhu's Eastwood
text:
Chinese backed developer Poly Australia has pulled out of due diligence to buy Yuhu Group's Eastwood Shopping Centre, after questions were raised about the council development approval in The Australian Financial Review on Wednesday.

Poly, backed by mega Chinese conglomerate China Poly Group, was understood to be the only group in talks to the buy the property, which was approved for a $277 million redevelopment in August after a three-year process.

Renderings of proposed Eastwood Plaza upgrade, which adds a tower of apartments atop the older-style shopping centre in Eastwood. Supplied

The property at Rowe and Rutledge Streets, which has high foot traffic, has approval for a facelift and a new apartment tower.

Chinese billionaire Huang Xiangmo, who is in the spotlight over a $141 million Tax Office bill, purchased the Eastwood property through Yuhu for $55 million in 2013.

Mr Huang is living in Hong Kong after the federal government cancelled his residency visa earlier this year.
description: Chinese backed developer Poly Australia has pulled out of due diligence to buy Yuhu Group's Eastwood Shopping Centre after questions were raised about the council development approval.
